metadata.title: CVE-2021-3531 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Red Hat Ceph Storage RGW in versions before14.2.21. When processing a GET Request for a swift URL that ends with twoslashes it can cause the rgw to crash, resulting in a denial of service.The greatest threat to the system is of availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-base - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-common - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-fuse - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mds - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-rook - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-mon - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-osd - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-prometheus-alerts - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
ceph-resource-agents - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
cephadm - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
cephfs-shell - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
crimson-osd - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-java - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-jni - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
libcephfs2 - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
librados2 - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
libradosstriper1 - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
librbd1 - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
librgw2 - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph-argparse - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph-common - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-cephfs - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-rados - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-rbd - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
python3-rgw - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
radosgw - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
rbd-fuse - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
rbd-mirror - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
rbd-nbd - 16.2.4-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '16.2.4-0ubuntu1').
